data.body:
You are given an array A of size N, consisting of elements between 1 and N-1, in random order, with only one number being repeated. Find this number.

Try to solve this using O(1) extra space.

hints.hint1: Can you find what the sum of all elements will be?
hints.hint2: The difference between the sum of numbers from 1….n-1 and the array sum is the answer.
hints.solution_approach:
There are multiple ways to solve this problem like hashing, sorting, etc.
Here we discuss two ways which will not require any extra space.
You can find the sum of all numbers till N-1 by the formula (N-1)*N / 2. The difference between the calculated sum and the sum of the array is the repeated number. Calculating the sum can result in overflow. You can avoid that by solving the problem with XOR. Find out the XOR of all numbers till N-1 and the XOR of all elements of the array. The XOR of these two will give the repeated number as all other numbers will cancel out.

data.input_format:
The first line contains an integer N - the size of the array A.
The next line contains N integers the elements of the array A.

samples.explanation: 2 is the only number repeated in the array.
